column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Create a Crisis Management Strategy
#Text=All organizations should have a crisis management policy which is at the same level of importance as the mission statement and business plan .
#Text=A proper crisis management policy can rapidly restore normality and confidence for workers in the organization .
#Text=It also provides a good source of PR material for the media .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determine whether it is a crisis .
#Text=This question is important to ask , as there are many situations that go wrong because the right person to handle it is not around .
#Text=You may be in charge of a project until your supervisor comes back and are unable to contact him during a crisis .
#Text=You have to make your own decisions in his absence and your action is dependent on the level of authority given .
#Text=See the Big Picture .
#Text=It is not easy to handle a crisis if you are not aware of the all the facts .
#Text=The final outcome may not be the way you envisage .
#Text=If your role is a leader , you have to be detached from the emotional side of the crisis and rationally take stock of how to move on .
#Text=Again , this is not as easy as it sounds as you may have longtime colleagues who are involved in this crisis .
#Text=Gather the Relevant Team .
#Text=It is important to be able to meet up with the relevant team to discuss about the situation .
#Text=This is to ensure that the team is able to analyse and make a united stand about handling this crisis .
#Text=This team should also comprise of the authorities , if the crisis is serious .
#Text=Set a Timeline .
#Text=You must construct a timeline and ensure that each process scenario is highlighted .
#Text=This practice will be a check to prevent your team from spending too much time in one aspect of handling the crisis .
#Text=Develop a Procedural Manual .
#Text=Is there an organizational situational manual that you can use for this situation ? Are you able to recollect the tips that were given to you when you participated in a mock drill ?
#Text=Seek External Experts .
#Text=You should get external experts to access the situation if the crisis is totally unanticipated .
#Text=However , you must have had a close-door meeting with your inner circle .
#Text=This is essential , as you do not want to unnecessarily reveal confidential information to external parties .
#Text=Speak To The Media .
#Text=It is important to prepare a press kit which provides a full detailed report about the crisis .
#Text=If you are comfortable to conduct a press interview , you have to ensure that you have the full details first .
#Text=Fine tune Your Communication Style .
#Text=You have to ensure that your communication style is in sync with the crisis .
#Text=Remember to be forthcoming with reliable information and try not to speculate .
#Text=This will also ensure that the victims ' immediate families do not overly worry .
#Text=It will also not help if you come across as very emotional in the media as you want to communicate that your organization has everything under control .
#Text=Protect your reputation .
#Text=If the crisis involves the loss of lives , it is not unthinkable that your credibility and organisation 's reputation is put into question .

#Text=Assuming that the crisis was beyond your organisation 's control , you have to stick to your best judgement and not be led into a debate that may open your organisation to possible legal action .
